To Hierum

Wuau 1 consider that you love your brother’s daughter with a more than maternal fondness, l see Ι ought to give you my latest news* first ; that sen- timents of joy may forestall and preclude anxiety. Though Ι sear indeed, even after your transports of gratulation you will feel some renewal of concern, and in the midst of your joy for the danger she has escaped, will tremble at the thought of that which she has undergone. She is now, however, in good spirits, and again restored to herself and to me; already she is making as rapid progress towards recovery, as she did towards her late danger. To tell you the truth, she was in the utmost danger (be it said without ill omen) ; for which no blame can be laid on her, but a good deal on her youthfulness To this must be imputed her miscarriage, and the sad result she has experienced of not knowing her condition.
